Chapter 3 How clean is clean? 3.1 All-Purpose Cleaner 3.2 Furniture Polish

Chapter 3 How clean is clean? Most cleaning jobs only need soap or detergent, water, and a little elbow grease. Some surfaces may need extra attention to control germs. Sanitizers reduce, but do not totally eliminate germs but are usually safer to use. Disinfectants destroy or inactivate germs but tend to be more toxic and must be used with care. Always label all cleaners clearly!!! 3.1 All-Purpose Cleaner 3.1.1 Ingredients 2 tablespoons borax 1/4 cup vinegar 2 cups hot water 3.1.2 Instructions Mix ingredients in a spray bottle or bucket. Apply and wipe clean 3.2 Furniture Polish 3.2.1 Ingredients 1 lemon 1 tablespoon of olive oil 1 tablespoon water 3.2.2 Instructions Cut and squeeze juice from lemon into small container, using a strainer to remove pulp and seeds Add oil and water. Mix well. Apply a thin coat on wood surface, then buff with a soft cloth to a deep shine
